issues.name: VL Embeddings: plan for Qwen3-VL-Embedding (hosted-only; provider TBD)
issues.description:
Goal: support a single fused VL embedding per entity (gallery/video) computed from (text_context + N images/frames), stored as one row per (entity_type, entity_id, model) and indexed for KNN.

Important constraint: Qwen/Qwen3-VL-Embedding-* is not currently available as a hosted API endpoint we can depend on. Design embeddingkit so that it can plug into a future hosted provider (URL-first inputs).

Reference script (pool-last-token + L2 normalize): https://huggingface.co/Qwen/Qwen3-VL-Embedding-8B/blob/main/scripts/qwen3_vl_embedding.py

[ ] Define entity VL contract: ONE stored vector per entity per model (no per-asset vectors in v1)
[ ] Define hard limits for VL inputs: max pages/frames, max total pixels, and max token length
=== MANGA/GALLERY STRATEGY ===
[ ] Decide page selection policy for galleries (e.g. cover + uniform samples; cap at N)
[ ] Decide whether to treat pages as "video frames" to reuse the HF script path (recommended for multi-page fusion)
[ ] Define chunking fallback for large galleries (e.g. 20 pages => 4 chunks of 5; embed each chunk; average+normalize)
=== HENTAI0/VIDEO STRATEGY ===
[ ] Use existing extracted frames as the VL inputs (no MP4 upload); cap frames and sample deterministically
[ ] Decide frame ordering and sampling (keyframes vs uniform; stable ordering for idempotency)
=== EMBEDDINGKIT API DESIGN ===
[ ] Extend `embeddingkit/vl` with a "fused" embed interface that accepts (text + N image URLs/video URLs) and returns ONE vector (hosted-only; URL inputs only)
[ ] Enforce URL-only inputs end-to-end (no raw bytes uploads to the hosted provider); AssetFetcher must return presigned/public URLs
[ ] Provide a simple fusion helper for chunk-level fusion (avg + L2 normalize) when inputs are chunked
=== HOSTED PROVIDER (FUTURE) ===
[ ] Add a provider adapter slot for a future hosted Qwen3-VL-Embedding endpoint (URL-only inputs)
[ ] Ensure model registry supports multiple VL models (2B/8B) at native dims without schema changes
=== STORAGE/SEARCH (APP-OWNED) ===
[ ] Document expected Postgres schema pattern for storing VL vectors (row-based, halfvec(K), HNSW indexes, and optional 2-stage binary oversample+rescore)
[ ] Document how apps switch active VL model and how to backfill safely

issues.name: Embedding/Search: extract to shared embeddingkit library
issues.description:
Goal: extract embedding generation + vector search core into a reusable Go module that both `~/doujins` and `~/hentai0` can consume. Keep domain-specific text composition and API response shapes inside each app, but share: (1) OpenAI-compatible embedding client + model mapping + dims, (2) pgvector/halfvec SQL/query helpers, (3) task table + worker primitives that can be driven by any job system.

Name: `embeddingkit` (Go module `github.com/doujins-org/embeddingkit`).

## Scope (what embeddingkit owns)

- Embedding clients
  - OpenAI-compatible text embedding client (DeepInfra/DashScope base URLs, model mapping, dims, timeouts/retries).
  - VL embedding interface (URL-only: text + N image/video URLs → ONE vector) behind an abstraction; provider-specific impls live in embeddingkit if stable.
- Vector storage + query helpers
  - Canonical pgvector/halfvec helpers (SQL fragments + Bun helpers).
  - Two-stage retrieval helpers (binary_quantize oversample + halfvec cosine rescoring).
  - Optional post-processing helpers (MMR/per-series cap).
- Task/work primitives (optional but recommended)
  - Generic task tables + repos for “embed entity X with model Y”.
  - Worker adapters (River adapter provided, but apps may use any job system/cron).

## Non-scope (what stays in apps)

- Domain text templates (how to turn a gallery/video into text) and any per-entity prompt/template logic.
- Domain routing/API response formats.
- Domain triggers (what changes require re-embedding); apps enqueue tasks, embeddingkit just provides helpers.

## Tables/migrations contract

- embeddingkit ships Postgres migrations (embedded via embed.FS) for its generic tables (River-style prefixed table names in the host schema):
  - `embeddingkit_embedding_tasks`
  - (future) `embeddingkit_entity_embeddings` if we later choose to centralize embedding storage instead of app-owned tables
  - optional helper views/index helpers if needed
- Apps run these migrations during their normal migration flow.
- Embeddings are language-agnostic in storage and search: the same stored vectors are used for multilingual queries.

## Integration contract (how apps interact)

Apps provide:
- DB handle + config (enabled models, dims, oversample factor, schema prefix).
- Callbacks/interfaces:
  - `TextDocumentBuilder(entityID) -> string` (language-agnostic)
  - `AssetLister(entityID) -> []AssetRef` + `AssetFetcher(AssetRef) -> URL` (for VL)
- Apps enqueue tasks and run a worker loop using either River or any other job system; apps hydrate final entities by ID.

This is a planning + refactor initiative intended to reduce duplicated logic and keep semantic search behavior consistent across projects.
